review_title: Can be a awesome place to work
pros: There is the opportunity for much learning, and also lot of resourceful staff there to help.
cons: Too much nepotism, and family do not necessarily know their role or the job for that matter.  Supervisors think they are god, and there is too much favoritism.  Many of them don't know how to speak with you as an equal or as a junior staff or as a human being.  You mostly feel like you have an uphill battle.  As it pertain to salaries, its not across the board with respect to qualification and experience, it all depends on which country you are from and who your boss is, or whether you are male or female.

pros: You get weekends off and major holidays off.  The
cons: The University is filled with like minded individuals who believe that the University should not progress and things should be the same as it was in 1887. There is no real training provided to make the staff better. There is no room for growth due to people retiring and being rehired. Pay structure IS NOT equivalent to the work. The job descriptions are the complete opposite from the actual job that you will be assigned.  There is no incentives to be better including the work environment.  Technology that is being used is sub-par.

review_title: Don't try to change nothing for the better because it wont work.
